cause.description:
Student/Farmworker Alliance (SFA) is a national network of students and youth organizing in direct partnership and solidarity with farmworkers to eliminate sweatshop conditions and modern-day slavery in the fields. We organize closely with the Coalition of Immokalee Workers (CIW), a membership-led community organization in SW Florida comprised largely of Latino, Haitian, and Mayan Indian immigrants working in agricultural and other low-wage jobs throughout the state.
We believe that only farmworkers can speak for themselves. SFA is dedicated to working with farmworkers for change, but we will not act on their behalf. Instead, we take our lead from the workers themselves. This affirms a belief in direct action and direct democracy where people and communities act through their own power to control and change their own lives.
----- Check out the regular SFA group here: http://facebook.com/group.php?gid=2307343628
1. EDUCATION | SFA facilitates activities through which students & farmworkers have the opportunity to come together to exchange knowledge & experiences.
2. ACTION | We aim to build a member base whose understanding of social change & injustice in the fields leads them to act in solidarity with farmworkers
3. LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT | We focus heavily on developing the skills and confidence of students and youth so they can organize in their communities.
cause.mission: Organizes in direct partnership & solidarity with the Coalition of Immokalee Workers to end sweatshop conditions & modern-day slavery in the fields.
